2.dug: Translated by Lilian Nyanje, Samuel Zaka & Hamisi Askari

4.dug: Kuna chit’u CHIMWENGA tu uhenzwacho uchimanye dzulu ya jisi chirusi cha k’orona
4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus

12.dug: Cho chirusi chinagot’a chikala madenwa gaga

13.dug: Fyalaluka k’anda. Mita 2 zinaidima kukwika salama kulaa kwa madenwa mabomu.
13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.

17.dug: Kwa vivyo uchona mut’u lwazu-lwazu unakohola/ unach’emula/ni mukongo unaidima kutsagula ku:
17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:

18.dug: Aphe vitambaa vya kufunga p’ula na mulomo/masiki. Anaidima kukoholera hebu akach’emulira na kurinda chila mut’u ariye phephi
18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby

22.dug: Phanjine hata ts’i mukongo, ela mwenye yunadzirinda tu.
22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself

23.dug: At’u odziambukizwa anaidima kuts’aonyesa dalili, ela acheri anaambukiza
23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious

24.dug: Na kwa jumula, ni azo idzo kudzitenga na virundu, kwa kukala k’umanya ni ani ariye ni mukongo.
24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.

27.dug: Mikowa kahi za gari ya moshi

28.dug: Vidude vya kufyeha vya mashine ya kupandira na kutsererera gorofani

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask

38.dug: Hata vivyo, ukati unjine mahe ga mut’u mukongo ganaidima kugwerera vit’u vinjine…
38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…

42.dug: Na uchigwira zani chit’u chochosi kati ya vivi, chidzako ukumbe usoo,
42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,

43.dug: na njira ya tende ya kuvyusa ni kuvyoga na sabuni, jik’i, hebu uchi.
43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.

44.dug: Virusi vinaidima kukala kwa masaa machache dzulu ya vit’u
44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,

47.dug: Ndo mana ni vidzo piya kutuwa yiyi
47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.dug: Uts’ikumbe usoo. (Hebu uso wa munzio.) Ichikala ni seti ukumbe, oga mikonoyo na sabuni chividzo kwanza.
51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.

52.dug: Ukati wa kutosha wa kwimba, “Ts’iku ya raha ya kuvyalwa” k’ano mbiri
52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice

56.eng: wash the back of your hands

58.dug: Uchikala udzikumba, uts’ijali. We chidzako oga mikonoyo na sabuni.
58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.

59.dug: Chisha, uts’ikumbe konze ya masiki ichikala vindaidimikika.
59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.

61.dug: Vidudu vinakula ndani ya masikiyo uchikala undazivala muno.
61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long

62.dug: Tsupha vitambaa vya kufunga p’ula na mulomo/masiki uchisikira zitsoka. Uts’izivale zaidi ya ts’iku mwenga!
62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!

68.dug: Uts’irye leu phamwenga na at’u, hebu mukats’anganya viya, vikombe hebu t’aulo.
68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.

69.dug: Kw’idima kukumba usoo na chikokorito hata ukakala wajeza.
69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried

70.dug: Fugula na kufunga muyango na chikokorito hebu mafuzi kurichisa mikono pharipho yinaidimikika.
70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.

72.eng: and after being out in the public

74.dug: Chila ukati oga mikonoyo na sabuni…
74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…

80.dug: Soma vitabumajarida kwa utumia unji Zaidi!
80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!

81.dug: 1.     “This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

82.dug: 1.     “The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report.  (Jan 25, 2020)
82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

83.dug: 1.     “How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)
83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

84.dug: Wiidimao kwauzira enye hasa dzulu ya udzumbe wa chiafya:

Additional notes: Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10

bookText.dug:
Dzulu ya virusi vya K’orona

Translated by Lilian Nyanje, Samuel Zaka & Hamisi Askari

Kuna chit’u CHIMWENGA tu uhenzwacho uchimanye dzulu ya jisi chirusi cha k’orona
CHIGOT’AVYO
Mulomoni
P’ulani
Matsoni
Gaphenya
Mut’u ariye ni muzima
Mut’u mukongo
Gaphenya

Cho chirusi chinagot’a chikala madenwa gaga
Fyalaluka k’anda. Mita 2 zinaidima kukwika salama kulaa kwa madenwa mabomu.
1
Mita 2
Hech’ii!
Kwa vivyo uchona mut’u lwazu-lwazu unakohola/ unach’emula/ni mukongo unaidima kutsagula ku:
Aphe vitambaa vya kufunga p’ula na mulomo/masiki. Anaidima kukoholera hebu akach’emulira na kurinda chila mut’u ariye phephi
2
Mumvera
*kuch’emula*
HEBU
Phanjine hata ts’i mukongo, ela mwenye yunadzirinda tu.
At’u odziambukizwa anaidima kuts’aonyesa dalili, ela acheri anaambukiza
Na kwa jumula, ni azo idzo kudzitenga na virundu, kwa kukala k’umanya ni ani ariye ni mukongo.

Mut’u yets’ikala mukongo.
Mikowa kahi za gari ya moshi
Vidude vya kufyeha vya mashine ya kupandira na kutsererera gorofani
Makodza ga chooni
Vikombe
Vifaa vya chidijitali
na hata konze ya masikiyo
Mut’u mwa kugwirira ngazini
Chidude cha komupyuta
K’alamu
Vigwarya vya miyango
Mikono yao
Hata vivyo, ukati unjine mahe ga mut’u mukongo ganaidima kugwerera vit’u vinjine…
mosi munaidima kukala akongo
hebu uso wa umuhenzaye
ufikitse matso
Na uchigwira zani chit’u chochosi kati ya vivi, chidzako ukumbe usoo,
na njira ya tende ya kuvyusa ni kuvyoga na sabuni, jik’i, hebu uchi.
Virusi vinaidima kukala kwa masaa machache dzulu ya vit’u
Sabuni
Mizizo
Ndo mana ni vidzo piya kutuwa yiyi
oga na sabuni muhadi hipha
Sabuni
Chikokorito
Uts’ikumbe usoo. (Hebu uso wa munzio.) Ichikala ni seti ukumbe, oga mikonoyo na sabuni chividzo kwanza.
Ukati wa kutosha wa kwimba, “Ts’iku ya raha ya kuvyalwa” k’ano mbiri
ts’ini ya k’ombe
kwa sekunde 20
Kati-kati ya vyala
oga nyuma ya mikonoyo
Chividzo nini?
Uchikala udzikumba, uts’ijali. We chidzako oga mikonoyo na sabuni.
Chisha, uts’ikumbe konze ya masiki ichikala vindaidimikika.
madenwa
Vidudu vinakula ndani ya masikiyo uchikala undazivala muno.
Tsupha vitambaa vya kufunga p’ula na mulomo/masiki uchisikira zitsoka. Uts’izivale zaidi ya ts’iku mwenga!
Humira chikasi
Mwanache
Baba
Mayo
Chila mut’u ahumire tauloye.
Uts’irye leu phamwenga na at’u, hebu mukats’anganya viya, vikombe hebu t’aulo.
Kw’idima kukumba usoo na chikokorito hata ukakala wajeza.
Fugula na kufunga muyango na chikokorito hebu mafuzi kurichisa mikono pharipho yinaidimikika.
Mudzini

Phots’i kurya
Chila ukati oga mikonoyo na sabuni…
Na kumarigiza,
Sabuni
Kalani salama, chila mut’u!
Kalani salama, chila mut’u!
Sabuni
Soma vitabumajarida kwa utumia unji Zaidi!
1.     “This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

1.     “The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report.  (Jan 25, 2020)

1.     “How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)

Wiidimao kwauzira enye hasa dzulu ya udzumbe wa chiafya:
Additional notes: Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: 1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing. 2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project 3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
Dzulu ya virusi vya K’orona
bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m-0.5m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

licenseNotes: Uts’igaluze udzumbe wa kazi yiyi, ela unaidima kuutafusiri, ukauhumira kwa njira zinjine, na ukaugot’eza hebu kuweneza kwa lengo ra kuts’auguza. Ni seti uzirinde zo haki na sifa za mwandiki wa chitabu na mwandiki wa p’icha Weiman Kou
summary: This book gives basic advice on dealing with the coronavirus COVID 19
